alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND CENTRAL MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Mechanicsburg, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... London, Jefferson, West Jefferson, Choctaw Lake, Lake Darby, Lafayette, Newport, Interstate 70 at US Route 42, Lilly Chapel, State Route 29 at State Route 38, Rosedale, Resaca, Georgesville, Interstate 70 at State Route 56, Madison Lake, Plumwood and Wrightsville. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 72 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
